head.title: HOME - Jemez Valley Public Schools

meta.content: ***NOTICE ***** Three or more Jemez Valley Board Members may attend a Tribal and Governing Board Retreat at Santa Ann Star Casino Hotel, Thursday February 28 and March 1,2019. This could constitute a quorum, however, no official board business will be conducted by the JVPS Board Members at this retreat, which would be a violation of the NM Open Meetings Act.

div.p:
Mission: The JVPS will ensure that all students will be inspired to succeed as lifelong learners through a collaborative and community based educational environment that embraces multi-cultural diversity.
Vision: The JVPS will be accountable for creating a culture of high academic standards, expectations and achievement based on a respect for diversity that supports individual needs and implements programs and services to cultivate student learning. JVPS will develop and maintain a sincere relationship with its families and community.

div.div:
District News & Information
Counselor's Corner Welcome to our new Social Emotional Learning Corner. We will be posting, offering tips on how to incorporate SEL into our daily lives.
We’ll begin with BUILDING SELF-ESTEEM, in our children.
TIPS:
Using a person’s name builds respect and SELF-ESTEEM. Self-esteem is ... click here to read more.
Low Cost Internet Discounted Internet Offerings compiled by NMPED - If you are interested, please contact the carrier directly. Not all providers may be able to provide service to your location.
Superintendent's Messages
Click here to read Dr. Susan Passell's messages to our families.
School Closure Information
Click here to read past message regarding school closure.
Google Classroom
Is now available for all students in grades PK - 12
If your student needs help with logging in, please contact your teacher.
Teachers will be creating student assignments. Please have your student log into their Google Mail, accept the classroom invitation and then log into the classroom.
Coronavirus (COVID-19) Video Resource
Vector has launched a complimentary coronavirus (COVID-19) video microcourse to help you and your loved ones stay safe and healthy. Available now, this course features critical information about the coronavirus, including:
How coronavirus spreads
How to recognize symptoms
How to prevent and treat the virus
What to do if you become sick with the virus
We strongly encourage you to share this video resource with your family members, friends, and colleagues so that everyone can collectively take proactive steps to stay healthy and prevent the spread of the virus.
Vector will update the course content with the latest information about the virus as it becomes available. https://www.vectorsolutions.com/about-us/vector-cares/
Is your contact information correct?
If you would like to receive text messages and currently do not receive them, you must Opt-in by texting "y" to 67587. You may also opt-in in Skyward Family Access.
Please ensure all phone numbers and emails are current. You may update your phone number by calling the school and leaving a message with your full name, your student’s full name and grade, along with the phone number or email address.
Elementary Office: 505-373-0054 ext 309 or 575-834-7393 ext 309
Middle/High School Office: 505-373-0137 ext 312 or 575-834-7392 ext 312
